sentences.en: A free radical is a molecular fragment having an unpaired electron.
sentences.cn: 自由基是一种具有未配对电子的分子碎体.

sentences.en: B . thuringiensis can be identified according to 500 bp amplified fragment.
sentences.cn: 500bp片段可以作为苏云金芽孢杆菌鉴定探针.

sentences.en: But that fragment of talk lodged , thick, in his small gizzard.
sentences.cn: 可是谈话的片断却深深盘据在他的小头脑里面.

sentences.en: Each fragment's immense kinetic energy was transform into heat.
sentences.cn: 每个碎片产生的巨大动能被转化为热能.

sentences.en: FP - Growth algorithm adopts pattern fragment growth method and only scans database twice.
sentences.cn: FP-Growth 算法是一种基于模式增长的频繁模式挖掘算法,避免了大量候选项集的产生,只需要两次扫描数据库.

sentences.en: Given the following program fragment , what values are printed?
sentences.cn: 下列程序段将会输出什么?

sentences.en: It enables a specific gene to be located on a particular restriction enzyme fragment.
sentences.cn: 它就能使专一的基因被定位于特定的限制性内切酶切成的片段上.

sentences.en: Restriction fragment length polymorphism ( RFLP ) technique used in cancer research.
sentences.cn: 1983年限制片段长度多态 ( RFLP ) 技术在癌症研究中应用.

sentences.en: Results Human motilin receptor was successfully cloned with correct open reading fragment.
sentences.cn: 结果成功克隆了人胃动素受体基因表达片段,测序证实读框正确.

sentences.en: She dropped the cup on the floor and it broke into fragment.
sentences.cn: 她把杯子扔到了地上,杯子摔成了碎片.

sentences.en: She read everything, digesting every fragment of news.
sentences.cn: 她什么都看，对新闻的每个片段都细细品味。

sentences.en: Some of the molecular ions fragment into smaller daughter ions and neutral fragments.
sentences.cn: 有些分子离子断裂成为较小的子离子和中性碎片.

sentences.en: the dangers of fragmenting the Health Service
sentences.cn: 医疗保健服务分崩离析的危险

sentences.en: The man could recall only a fragment of the accident.
sentences.cn: 这个人只能回忆起那场事故中的一些片段.

sentences.en: Translocation occurs when a fragment of one chromosome becomes attached to a non - homologous chromosome.
sentences.cn: 一段染色体跟 非 同源染色体连在一起时就发生易位.

sentences.en: You will encounter memory fragment problem of the standard finally.
sentences.cn: 你最终将遇到标准的内存碎片问题.

trans.tran_cn: 碎片，片段，未完成的部分，（将文件内容）分段
trans.tran_en: a small piece of something that has broken off or that comes from something larger
to break something, or be broken into a lot of small separate parts – used to show disapproval
